meanings.definition: Spoil the surface or appearance of (something)
meanings.sent1: Accidentally, the child defaces the drawing with crayon marks.
meanings.sent2: Graffiti defaces the clean walls of the building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy defaces the freshly painted fence with muddy paw prints.
meanings.sent4: Time defaces memories like a relentless artist erasing a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The vandal's spray paint defaces the statue, leaving an ugly scar.

meanings.sent1: The scratch defaces the shiny surface of the car.
meanings.sent2: The storm defaces the beautiful garden with fallen branches.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy waiter accidentally defaces the fancy cake with his thumbprint.
meanings.sent4: Neglect can slowly deface the charm of an old house.
meanings.sent5: The artist's signature defaces the authenticity of the ancient painting.
